explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the application of the factorization machine model, a machine learning technique, for credit risk assessment.
explanations.supervised learning: The factorization machine model is used for classification and regression tasks, which are supervised learning problems.
explanations.classification: The paper explicitly mentions that the factorization machine can be used for classification tasks, and compares its performance with other classification approaches.
explanations.regression: The paper mentions that the factorization machine can be used for regression tasks through appropriate feature transformation.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper compares the performance of the factorization machine model with support vector machines (SVM) in credit risk assessment.
explanations.SVM: SVM is mentioned as one of the classification approaches compared with the factorization machine model.
explanations.neural network: The paper compares the performance of the factorization machine model with artificial neural networks in credit risk assessment.
